Description: Fragment of shoulder and turn to neck of North Ionian pottery closed vase, amphora pr oenochoe; slight moulded ridge at base of neck. Thin cream slip on exterior. frieze of simple tongues, some with added red, between bands at top of shoulder; below, opposed grazing wild goat (most preserved) and lion (front part only) amid filling ornament of rosettes and swastilkoids; heavy, but careful incision and areas of added red on animals.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.013)
